result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $6,250.00 payable to Anthony P.  Joint and several with 14CF535 or civl judgment with tax intercept. Bail to apply if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.

Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school, and or vocational training.

No drugs or alcohol, unless medically assisted treatment.
Do not frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.

Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
*Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Concurrent with: Credit for 48 days.
**Defendant is immediately eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and is immediately eligible for the  Substance Abuse Program.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to SUPERINTENDENT sKALSKI sT. cROIX cORRECTIONAL cTR. p.o.bOX 36 nEW rICHMOND wi 54017-0036. OS

PURSUANT to Sec 973.01, WI Stats. BRIAN WALLACE was sentenced on 5/6/2015 to a bifurcated sentence on COUNT 1 of 2 YEARS, confinement and 2 YEAR(S) extended supervision for a TOTAL SENTENCE OF 4 YEARS and on COUNT 2 of 2 YEARS, confinement and 2 YEAR(S) extended supervision for a TOTAL SENTENCE OF 4 YEARS.  The defendant was deemed eligible for participation in the Challenge Incarceration Program, in accordance with Sec. 302.05(3)(a)(2), Wisconsin Statues. 

PURSUANT to Sec. 302.05(3)(c), WI Stats., within 30 days after the court has been notified that the defendant has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program, the court shall modify the bifurcated sentence.  The portion of the Confinement Time not served will be added to the Extended Supervision portion of the sentence.  The total length of the sentence will not change.

Whereas, BRIAN WALLACE entered and began participation in the Challenge Incarceration Program on 11/4/2015.

Whereas, BRIAN WALLACE has successfully completed the Challenge Incarceration Program of 5/27/2016.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by DOC Central Records, and will be based upon actual release date.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
In all other respects, the original judgment herein is affirmed.

Paperwork forwarded to the Clerk of Court's Office to amend the judgment of conviction.  lms
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. br. 6, Judge Brostrom.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (19 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing MAY 6, 2015 received and filed.
received and filed.  lms

Defendant Brian E Wallace in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Brian E Wallace in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing. 
COUNT 1 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, with credit for 48 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  The defendant IS immediately eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS immediately eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

COUNT 2 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 48 MONTHS, with credit for 48 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 24 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  The defendant IS immediately eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS immediately eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Restitution payable to Kaelynn and Anthony P for $6,250.00, joint and several with 14CF535 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Brian E Wallace in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Brian E Wallace in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in br. 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian E Wallace in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Brian E Wallace in custody.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: 
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 7/16/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Case is adjourned to Branch 34.
